column1: Araraquara (Portuguese pronunciation: [ɐɾaɾɐˈkwaɾɐ] or [aˌɾaɾɐˈkwaɾɐ]) is a city in the state of São Paulo in Brazil. The population is 226
column2: 508 (2015 est.) in an area of 1004 km². It is also known as "the abode of the sun
column3:
because of its impressive sunset and because of its hot atmosphere, especially in summer. The city was founded in 1817.


== History ==


=== Etymology ===
There are two possible origins for the name of the city. One that links it to the Tupi-Guarani language of the region's indigenous inhabitants, and another that relates it to the Língua Geral of São Paulo.The two versions come from similar expressions  arará kûara" and "arara kûara"

column2: part of the Mesoregion of Araraquara
column3: and is 270 km north of São Paulo.
